artwork.creator: Dorothea Lange
artwork.title: Japanese American-owned grocery store, Oakland, California (National Gallery of Art)
artwork.subject: Japanese Americans, Forced Removal and Internment, Wartime Civil Control Administration
artwork.label: Oakland, Calif., Mar. 1942. A large sign reading 'I am an American' placed in the window of a store, at [401 - 403 Eighth] and Franklin streets, on December 8, the day after Pearl Harbor. The store was closed following orders to persons of Japanese descent to evacuate from certain West Coast areas. The owner, a University of California graduate, will be housed with hundreds of evacuees in War Relocation Authority centers for the duration of the war. (LOC)
